quizzes.title: History Quiz: Mafia and Bosses
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, people, fighters. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Triads is the name of the Japanese Mafia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The execution of a member of the American Mafia is called Omerta.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which U.S. President, nicknamed Old Hickory, was the target of an assassination attempt at the Capitol building in 1835 by a house painter named Richard Lawrence?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Andrew Jackson

questions.question: Lucky Luciano was one of the most important bosses of the Mafia, because he literally created its structure as we know it today. This guy was his most loyal friend since childhood.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Meyer Lansky

questions.question: Which U.S. President, whose term was the second shortest in the nations history, died in 1881, two and a half months after he was shot at a train station in Washington, D.C.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James A. Garfield

questions.question: In the Italian-American Mafia, the hierarchy is very strict. Capo di Tutti Capi means Boss of all Bosses. This is the highest possible position in the chain of command. Then who is Capo Crimini?

options.text: A non-Italian member of the Mafia
The Don of a crime family

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Don of a crime family

questions.question: There are many theories about the source and the translation of the word Mafia. However, the meaning of the name of the Italian Mafia, La Cosa Nostra, is not so controversial. Which of these translations is closest?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Our Thing

questions.question: There were five dominant families in the American Mafia.  The Bonanno family, the Colombo Family, the Gambino family, the Lucchese family and one more. Charles (Lucky) Luchiano was one of the Bosses of this powerful Mafia family.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Genovese Family

questions.question: Al Capone was the Crime Boss in Chicago as the successor of Johnny Torrio. Although he committed many terrible crimes and violated many laws, he was convicted only of tax evasion and had to do 11 years in Alcatraz. He was released in 1939 due to his terrible disease. What was this disease?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Syphilis

questions.question: If you are a member of Yakuza and disobey your boss, you have to cut one of your fingertips and send it to him, begging for forgiveness.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This is one of the most famous crime fighters in the history of the American Mafia. He prosecuted many gangsters, such as Lucky Luciano, Gurrah Shapiro and Louis Lepke. The mafioso Dutch Shultz was killed by his peers, because he planned to knock off this gang buster.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Dewey

questions.question: Which U.S. President, shot at the Pan-American Exposition in Buffalo, New York, might have survived if doctors had used a new medical device on exhibit at the fair that could have helped them find the fatal bullet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William McKinley

questions.question: Which U.S. President, the first in the nations history to be assassinated, died at Peterson House across the street from the site of his shooting?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Abraham Lincoln

questions.question: The Mafia was actually formed in Sicily in the Middle Ages as a secret society to resist the Turk and Norman invaders. Later, it spread to the United States and this was the first American city where it became influential.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York

questions.question: Which U.S. President, who had become President after the 1901 assassination of his predecessor, survived an assassination attempt more than three years after he left office?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Theodore Roosevelt

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Office and Target
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, massachusetts, leader. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This American journalists catch line was Hello America. This is London calling.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edward R Murrow

questions.question: Which U.S. President, shot by a man who wanted to impress a film actress, was not the original target of the assassination plan?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ronald W. Reagan

questions.question: Which President, who resided in Blair House during renovations to the White House, commuted the death sentence of the man convicted of plotting to assassinate him?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harry S. Truman

questions.question: Which four-term Presidents motorcade was shot at a month before he first took office, resulting in the death of the mayor of Chicago?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Franklin D. Roosevelt

questions.question: During the administration of which U.S. President, the last to be given lifetime Secret Service protection, were three attacks carried out against the White House?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William J. Clinton

questions.question: In 1920, this Eddie founded a company for outdoor clothing in Seattle.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eddie Bauer

questions.question: Which U.S. President, the first Massachusetts native to hold the office in more than 130 years, was targeted by a would-be suicide attacker before his inauguration?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John F. Kennedy

questions.question: Which U.S. President was the target of an assassination attempt during a state visit to the former Soviet republic of Georgia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George W. Bush

questions.question: Which President, never elected to the office, was the target of two assassination attempts within three weeks of each other, both by women?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gerald R. Ford

questions.question: This Eddie married One Day at a Time star Valerie Bertinelli.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eddie Van Halen

questions.question: Which controversial President was the target of an assassination plot that involved hijacking a commercial airliner and crashing it into the White House?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard M. Nixon

questions.question: Which U.S. President was targeted for assassination by a foreign leader three months after he left office?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George H.W. Bush

questions.question: On The Honeymooners, which was on the air from 1955 - 1956, Ed Norton was portrayed by which actor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Art Carney

questions.question: Which Edward portrayed Lou Grant on the Mary Tyler Moore show?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edward Asner

questions.question: Which U.S. President, during whose adminstration a U.S. Embassy in the middle east was seized, was supposedly targeted by Mexican assassins in an attack that never took place?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jimmy Carter

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Eddie and Songs
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, actor, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In 1981,this Ed  joined the staff of 60 Minutes, an investigative television newsmagazine on CBS News.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ed Bradley

questions.question: Two Tickets to Paradise, released in 1977 was this Eddies first hit.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eddie Money

questions.question: Kellie Shanygne Williams portrayed Laura Winslow on which television sitcom?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Family Matters

questions.question: Kellie Martin, famous for portraying Becca Thatcher in Life Goes On, also played Dr. Lucy Knight on which popular show?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ER

questions.question: Some of the characters, played by this Eddie are Axel Foley, Quick, and Professor Sherman Klump.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eddie Murphy

questions.question: Which of these songs was not recorded by Kelly Clarkson, the first winner of the reality TV show American Idol?

options.text: In The Arms of The Angels

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In The Arms of The Angels

questions.question: For more than 30 years this Ed used to say Heres Johnny.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ed McMahon

questions.question: Kelly Rippa, host of  Live with Regis and Kelly, co-stars with which actress on the sitcom Hope and Faith?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Faith Ford

questions.question: When Elvis Presley appeared on this Eds TV show, the camera was only allowed to show him from the waist up.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ed Sullivan

questions.question: Kelly Preston, who played Linda in Addicted to Love, married which famous actor in 1991?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Travolta

questions.question: Which actress is famous for playing Lisa in the 1985 movie Weird Science?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kelly LeBrock

questions.question: Who portrays Edward in the 1990 movie Edward Scissorhands, which tells the story of an artificial man who had scissors instead of hands?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johnny Depp

questions.question: This actor, whose first name is Eddie, plays Oliver Wendell Douglas in Green Acres.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eddie Albert

questions.question: In Pretty Woman Edward Lewis picks up Vivian Ward, a beautiful prostitute, played by Julia Roberts.  Who portrayed Edward?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard Gere

questions.question: This Eddie is famous for performing songs such as Drinkin My Baby Off My Mind (1976), You Dont Love Me Anymore (1978), I Love a Rainy Night (1980), Drivin My Life Away (1980), Step by Step (1981).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eddie Rabbit

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Dracula and Order
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, john, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In 1967, John Lennon of the Beatles bought an island called Dorinish which was located in what part of the world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ireland

questions.question: Draculas mansion was in Novi Sad.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Once enthroned, Vlad became famous for his favourite torture - the impalement. It earned him this nickname, which meant the impaler.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tepes

questions.question: At the age of 45 Dracula was killed in a battle. This is what happened to him after his death.

options.text: His body was thrown in a river.
He was proclaimed a National patron.
He was buried in the place of the battle.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: His head was cut off.

questions.question: The title count was invented by Bram Stoker in his famous novel. This is what the real title of Dracula was.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Prince

questions.question: The popular musical Singin in The Rain, released in 1952 starred dancer/actor Art Kelly.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: These people are not doomed to become a vampire according to Romanian legends.

options.text: The seventh son of a seventh son

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Homeless people

questions.question: Dracula was a great defender of Christianity - he built 5 monasteries. That is why he initially had the blessing of this authority.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Vatican

questions.question: Parents in Romania used to threaten their children by telling them that Dracula would come if they were not good.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In the movie The Scorpion King, actress Kelly Hu co-starred with which former WWF wrestling champion?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Rock

questions.question: In the mid 1980s a Dracula disease was found. Its characteristics included pointed teeth, excessive hair, extreme sensitivity to light, and the need for blood. This is the medical name of the disease.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Porphyria

questions.question: The Order to which his family belonged fought against this empire.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ottoman

questions.question: Mostly known as a hero, Vlad Dracula was born in a noble family. His surname comes from the order to which his father belonged. What was its name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Order of the Dragon

questions.question: What is the birth name of Kelly Rowland, one of the founding members of the successful musical group Destinys Child?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kelendria Trene Rowland

questions.question: In 2003, Kelly Osbourne recorded a duet with her father, Ozzy Osbourne, which Black Sabbath song?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Changes

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Half and Discovery
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, john, actor. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Pope John Paul II, the first non-Italian Pope since 1522, was born in which European country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Poland

questions.question: What was the nickname of John Simon Ritchie-Beverly, member of English punk band The Sex Pistols?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sid Vicious

questions.question: Who was the long-suffering wife of the Greek god Zeus?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hera

questions.question: Which one of these statements about U.S. President John F. Kennedy is true?

options.text: He was a devoted Evangelical Presbyterian.
He was the first U.S. President born in the 20th century.
He was the 36th President of the United States.
He was born in Boston, Massachusetts.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was the first U.S. President born in the 20th century.

questions.question: Who were the Spanish monarchs who funded the discovery of the New World?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ferdinand and Isabella

questions.question: Who was the other half of this famous twosome: Mark Antony and ...?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cleopatra

questions.question: Which of the following historic persons makes up a famous duo with Julius Caesar as one half?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cleopatra

questions.question: Which one of these famous Western movies did not star American actor John Wayne?

options.text: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly

questions.question: According to the Canonical Gospels, how did Saint John the Baptist die?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was beheaded.

questions.question: Which of the following women was not a wife of King Henry VIII of England?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anne Hathaway

questions.question: Which one of these names of popular musicians is the real birthname of that musician?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Frusciante

questions.question: The famous pirate Long John Silver, a fictional character from the book Treasure Island, has what body part missing?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leg

questions.question: John Locke, a character from the television series Lost, was named after what real historical figure?

options.text: A fictional character from Mark Twains books.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A philosopher

questions.question: Which American author, born in 1955, wrote the bestselling books A Time to Kill, The Pelican Brief, The Client, The Runaway Jury and The Firm?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Grisham

questions.question: Who was the husband of Archduchess Marie Antoinette of Austria?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Louis XVI

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Outlaw and Love
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, people, jesse. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In the 1897 play Cyrano de Bergerac, who was the one love of the great-nosed poet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roxanne

questions.question: Newspapers sometimes mistakenly listed the name of an infamous Old West gunman as Johnny Ringgold instead of Johnny Ringo.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Henry McCarty is said to be the real name of the notorious Old West outlaw Billy the Kid.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What year did the Tate/ LaBianca murders take place?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1969

questions.question: Gunman Charles Bolles was a stagecoach robber in California and Oregon.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who was the great love of Italian poet Dante Alighieris life?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beatrice

questions.question: Who was Napoleons favorite wife?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Josephine

questions.question: Frank James became a shoe salesman after giving up the outlaw life.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Old West outlaw Jesse James formed a gang with Cole Younger.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Old West gunman William Brocius was also known as Wild Bill.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Notorious Old West outlaw Tom Ketchum was also known as Tom Terrific.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Old West gunman Harvey Logan was also known as Kid Curry.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Outlaw William Brooks was known also by the nickname Buffalo Bill.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Aside from his One God, who was the human love in Egyptian Pharaoh Akhenatens life?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nefertiti

questions.question: Old West gunman Burt Alvord was an Arizona marshal before becoming an outlaw.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True
